DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text entry to capture a stage of disease when the AJCC (American Joint Commission on Cancer) staging criteria are not used to make the determination.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease Stage Criteria Non American Joint Committee on Cancer Identification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Performing exams and tests to learn the extent of the cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body. It is important to know the stage of the disease in order to plan the best treatment_An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._The procedure of having an identity established.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The extent of a cancer in the body.

Property.preferredName: Negation American Joint Committee on Cancer Identification
Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.:The procedure of having an identity established.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
The procedure of having an identity established.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.::25_An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases)._Text; the words of something written.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.::25:An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).
